exm.mng: lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch, back to square one, to start of on a new path
to give preferential treatment, to give special attention
Zaoshen, the god of the kitchen
to fall (from power), in decline, unlucky
large kitchen stove made from bricks or earth, (PRC) ordinary mess hall (lowest dining standard, ranked below 中灶[zhong1 zao4] for mid-level cadres and 小灶[xiao3 zao4] for the most privileged)
Zaoshen, the god of the kitchen, also written 灶神
